results.name: default/wordpress-65b78d8b44-mcgld

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.

results.name: default/wordpress-service

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-65b78d8b44-mcgld], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not ready because it has no available endpoints; the pod "wordpress-65b78d8b44-mcgld" is not ready, but 1 is expected.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs wordpress-65b78d8b44-mcgld`.
3. Verify pod readiness probes.
4. Ensure pod has no pending issues.
5. Restart pod if necessary.
